question.title: VSCode cannot find import with a valid maven pom.xml file
question.body:
I have a local jar I'm including in my pom.xml via <repository>. When I run mvn clean install it executes fine. I can deploy my code in spring boot and the code works perfectly (the local jar is detected).

When I am editing my .java code in VSCode, I keep getting those red squiggly marks saying the import foo.bar cannot be resolved

The only way I can get rid of the red squiggly marks and have VSCode detect the jar is if I comment out the <repository> section and edit the <dependency> to include <scope> and <systemPath>. I'd rather not do this because A) systemPath should not be used as many posts have noted and B) I'd have to do extra config work to pull it into my docker environment so that it exists upon running my application.

Is there a way to get VSCode to correctly detect the <repository> tag and use it?

    <repositories>
        <repository>
            <id>project-local-repo</id>
            <url>${project.basedir}/src/lib/someGroup/someArtifact-someVersion.jar</url>
        </repository>
    </repositories>
    <dependencies>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>someGroup</groupId>
            <artifactId>someArtifact</artifactId>
            <version>someVersion</version>
            <!-- I shouldn't have to use scope/systemPath -->
            <scope>system</scope>
            <systemPath>${project.basedir}/src/lib/someGroup/someArtifact-someVersion.jar</systemPath>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>

FWIW I have the VSCode extension installed for Maven for Java

Update

I have the following folder structure on disk.

someParentFolder
 |-someJavaProject
 |-someJavascriptProject
 |-someOtherRelatedProject

When I open a new vscode instance, I usually do File->Open Folder->someParentFolder. This way I can work across all my related projects in one vscode window

If I instead open a new vscode window and do File->OpenFolder->someJavaProject, then the 3rd party import resolves fine.

So I'm guessing vscode cannot resolve custom jars from a parentFolder (yet the other deps are fine)??

FWIW, commented out the <repositories> tag in the pom.xml file and then inside the someJavaProject folder I ran

mvn org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-install-plugin:3.1.3:install-file -Dfile=<path-to-my-custom-jar>
mvn clean install

and validated that all external and custom jars are in my .m2 folder
